name: Andrius
desc: The Great Wolf King of the North, a protector of Wolvendom and one of the Four Winds.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>October 15, 2020</color>
This tale began a thousand years ago, when Mondstadt's rulers fell from grace. The southern lion their crowns to the earth did throw, and the west wind arose and took their place.
The guardian of the north returned, and near to the wolven wood he drew. The Four Winds blew each in their turn, and united they built Mondstadt anew.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

customize.name: Decarabian
customize.desc: The God of Storms and the ruler of Old Mondstadt. He was overthrown as a result of an uprising raised by the people of Mondstadt, who could not withstand the tyranny.

customize.text: The God of Storms, who fought with Andrius 3000 years ago.

customize.name: Barbatos
customize.desc: The Anemo Archon of Mondstadt.

customize.text: The Anemo Archon Barbatos, who made peace with Andrius when Decarabian was overthrown.

customize.name: Four Winds
customize.desc: The four guardians of Mondstadt, who were summoned a thousand years ago and answer to the Anemo Archon. The Four Winds include the Wolf of the North, the Falcon of the West, the Lion of the South, and the Dragon of the East.

customize.name: Vennessa
customize.desc: A former slave, the founder and the first Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius, and the Dandelion Knight.

customize.name: Boreal Wolf's Milk Tooth
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Andrius' wolf pack is its blessed honor guard, and even the milk teeth of a wolf cub possess great potential.
In the past, the gods had the responsibility to love all people. Andrius was therefore quite unusual in that he became leader of the wolves, while only welcoming abandoned babies and wanderers when it came to humans.

customize.name: Boreal Wolf's Cracked Tooth
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The life of a wolf is not without violence; broken bones or cracked teeth are nothing special.
Andrius found humans to be a disappointment, but believed babies to be innocent. If both the wolf pack and the adopted children chose each other, then they become a Lupical, a fated family.

customize.name: Boreal Wolf's Broken Fang
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The wolf pack also understands that humans are not solitary creatures. The honorary broken tooth is a parting gift said to bring protection and luck.
In the legends of a far-off world, a female wolf once adopted two great humans. Their home was known as the Cave of Wolves, or Lupercal - that word meaning the same thing as Lupical does in this world.

customize.name: Boreal Wolf's Nostalgia
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The Wolf King, believing himself to despise humans, thought himself unable to envision a happy life for humanity, making him unworthy of becoming the Lord of the Winds of the world. Therefore, he chose to disappear. Yet, in truth, he gazes on the ones abandoned by the world ever so gently.

customize.name: Spirit Locket of Boreas
customize.desc:
A bit of the Great Wolf King of the North's power drawn from its soul.
This land was once a realm of freezing-cold blizzards and ice storms filled with razor-sharp ice shards, all at the command of Boreas. In his final moments, he finally realized the chilling north wind could only extinguish life, not nurture it. Therefore, Boreas let his powers freely flow into the land to protect it and its inhabitants.

customize.name: Ring of Boreas
customize.desc:
A bit of crystallized ice from the Great Wolf King of the North.
This land was once a realm of freezing-cold blizzards and ice storms filled with razor-sharp ice shards, all at the command of Boreas. Though his power may have diminished, he could still freeze the land in an instant.

customize.name: Tail of Boreas
customize.desc:
A handful of tail scales from the Great Wolf King of the North.
Even without his physical body and beyond death, Boreas still possesses extraordinary powers. He took a form comprised of ice and wind to embrace a new challenge, but even such a form could not house all of his power. The ice scales that fell during the battle still retain some of their spiritual energy.

customize.text: Thousands of years ago, an ancient god gave powers to Andrius, so he became King of the North Wind. He was a noble soul who protected Wolvendom. When the wolfpack was imperiled, he emerged in the form of a wolf and showed forth its fangs and claws.

About 3,000 years ago, the Great Wolf King of the North waged a war with the God of Storm, Decarabian. Andrius froze Mondstadt and forced Decarabian to create walls of storms around Old Mondstadt (now Stormterror's Lair). When the God of Storm was overthrown and Barbatos became the new Archon, Andrius stopped fighting. He finally realized the chilling north wind could only extinguish life, not nurture it; therefore, Boreas let his powers freely flow into the land to protect it and its inhabitants. Andrius allowed his physical body to die and took on the form of a wolf made of ice and wind.

When, 1,000 years ago, the Aristocracy ruling Mondstadt was overthrown by the slave Vennessa, who then founded the Knights of Favonius and convened the Four Winds, Andrius became one of the Four Winds protecting Mondstadt. Once upon a time, the Temple of the Wolf was built for him, where people worshiped the Wolf of the North, but over time, the Four Winds were forgotten.
Many years ago, a mechanism called the "Field Tiller" accidentally ended up in Andrius's arena, and he mistook the mechanism for a brave man who challenged him. The machine could not think, but every part of it was designed for killing and fighting. It could spin, fly high into the air, and shoot fireballs. In the end, Andrius was able to defeat the machine, but it managed to leave the arena before falling. For the people of ancient Mondstadt, the "Field Tiller" became the "Tyrant's Final Fury," as they could not understand the true nature of the mechanism. This machine was the prototype for all the Ruin Guards made in Khaenri'ah and possessed the Eye of the first Field Tiller, with the help of which the Abyss Order, opposed to the Seven Kingdoms, tried to create a mechanical deity to overthrow the gods of Celestia from their thrones.
Nowadays, the wolves of Wolvendom have almost no contact with people, but one day they accepted a child into their pack, later named Razor, whom they consider their "Lupical," that is, family. One day, the Abyss Order wanted Andrius to serve them, and in return, they promised the spirit to return his divine powers. The Abyss Herald attempted to perform a ritual to possess the mind of the King of the North, just as the Abyss mage once poisoned the mind of the Dragon of the East, Dvalin. The Herald lured Andrius under the pretense of challenging him to battle but was stopped by Razor and the Traveler.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Archon War
customize.desc: The war for the divine thrones, declared by the Heavenly Principles. As a result of the Archon War that finished about 2000 years ago, seven rulers of seven nations received the Gnoses, the divine throne, and the title of an Archon.

customize.name: Decarabian
customize.desc: The God of Storms and the ruler of Old Mondstadt. He was overthrown as a result of an uprising raised by the people of Mondstadt, who could not withstand the tyranny.

customize.name: Barbatos
customize.desc: The Anemo Archon of Mondstadt.

customize.name: Vennessa
customize.desc: A former slave, the founder and the first Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius, and the Dandelion Knight.

customize.name: Razor
customize.desc: A boy who lives among the wolves in Wolvendom of Mondstadt, away from human civilization. As agile as lightning.

customize.name: Abyss Herald: Wicked Torrents
customize.desc:
Servants of the Abyss Order that use Hydro in combat.
These silent figures are the vanguard of the Abyss, brandishing Tidal Blades that can engulf everything in an instant, crumpling armor and obliterating heretics. They shall bring preordained damnation upon the foolish masses.

customize.name: Lupus Boreas, Dominator of Wolves
customize.desc:
The noblest and greatest of souls, who watches over the lupical of Wolvendom.
When the wolfpack is imperiled, it will emerge in the form of a wolf and show forth its fangs and claws.

The wolves of Wolvendom are frightening phantoms to the people of Mondstadt:
A blurred shape flashing through the forest, a chilling howl in the indeterminate distance, the creeping sense of eyes constantly nailed to their backs...
Humans rarely have the opportunity to lock their eyes with a wolf, for this is the law Lupus Boreas laid down for its race.

customize.name: Dvalin
customize.desc: An Elemental Dragon and the Anemo Archon Barbatos's friend. After being poisoned by the Shadow Dragon's blood, he became known as Stormterror.

customize.name: Boreal Wolf's Cracked Tooth
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
